result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle A. Olson

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 154 pm. 
INCLUDES: 20CF819, 20CM1131, 22CF155, and 22CF649. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Heather Roehr. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 22CF649:
Waiver of Prelim to be filed.  
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  R/W; R/J. 

PLEA/SENTENCING: 
State moves to: 
22CF155 --
Ct.1>>DRI.
Ct.2>>DRI.
Ct.3>>DRI.
Ct.4>>DRI.
Ct.5>>DRI.
Ct.6>>DRI.

22CF649 --
Ct.2>>DRI.
Ct.3>>DRI.
Ct.4>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
20CF819 --
Ct.1>>GUILTY. 

20CM1131 --
Ct.1>>GUILTY. 

22CF649 --
Ct.1>>GUILTY.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
20CF819 --
Ct.1>>SWH for 3 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and follow through.  Pay restitution in the amount of $1022.47.  Restitution TBD within 60 days.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample.

20CM1131 --
Ct.1>>SWH for 1 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and follow through. Restitution TBD in the other two files, with 60 days to file.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample.

22CF649 --
Ct.1>>SWH for 3 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and follow through. Restitution TBD within 60 days.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample.
 

COURT grants 0 days credit. 
Adj: 2:09 pm.




**amended 10/4 ajn**
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case Called at 2:42 pm. 
INCLUDES: 20CF819, 20CM1131, 20CF155 and 22CF649.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Heather Roehr. 
VRCW. 

Parties have reached an agreement and wish to set a Plea/Sentencing. 

NEXT DATE:
Plea/Sentencing set for 9/6 at 1:45pm. 
Adj: 2:43 pm.

- No contact with victim(s): Walmart & Sam's (everywhere). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Prints and photograph.
